p: One of the fundamental features of cancer is tumor clonality, which means the development of tumors from single cells that begin to proliferate abnormally [ 20]. This process can be retarded by activities such as apoptosis, cytotoxicity, and antiproliferative activity. An antiproliferative activity is what retards the growth of cells, and so, cancer cells are prevented from multiplying rapidly. Besides, there is cytotoxicity which means causing harm to these rapidly proliferating cells and thereby killing them [ 21].
